required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Active Powered Prosthesis (APEX) for Spinal Cord Injury
clinical_study.official_title: Active Powered Prosthesis (APEX) for Spinal Cord Injury

collaborator.agency: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

brief_summary.textblock: The Active Powered Prosthesis (APEX) (AbiliTech Medical Inc., Minneapolis, MN) is a proof-of-concept shoulder-elbow-wrist device intended to provide non-invasive active powered robotic assistive movement to upper extremities. The objective of this study is to perform focus groups with users and clinicians to evaluate a proof of concept active powered assistance device.

primary_outcome.measure: User ability to operate the APEX device
primary_outcome.time_frame: Two hours of in-clinic prototype evaluation
primary_outcome.description: Users evaluate the usability and performance of the APEX device in completion of Activities of Daily Living (ADLs).

arm_group.description: Target user population will be human subjects with spinal cord injury at levels C3 to C5, and ASIA Impairment Scale (AIS) A, B, or C.

intervention.intervention_name: Active Powered Prosthesis (APEX) for Spinal Cord Injury
intervention.description: The Active Powered Prosthesis (APEX) is a proof-of-concept shoulder-elbow-wrist device intended to provide non-invasive active powered robotic assistive movement to upper extremities. Focus group participants will control the APEX device on a test manikin and provide feedback on the device design and function.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Spinal cord injury at levels C3 to C5, and AIS A, B, or C
2. Greater than 3-months post injury or surgery to the spinal column, arms, or shoulder
3. Ability to provide informed consent
4. Age 18 or over
5. Selected for participation based on investigator discretion
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Unable to follow instructions
2. Exhibit significant behavioral problems or impaired cognitive ability
3. Inability to provide consent
4. Non-English speaker

facility.name: Allina Health Courage Kenny Rehabilitation Institute
